Sequence Information.Peptide Name: ModoCath1 (cathelicidin, natural AMPs; mammals, animals, UCLL1; more AMPs?)
Sequence Information.Source: the gray short-tailed opossum,Monodelphis domestica, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (41.7%) tofrog Hymenochirin-1B.Activity: MIC assays using gram-positive strains, S. aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC 0.85 uM), Bacillus cereus ATCC 10876 (MIC 8.5 uM), and E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 0.57 uM), and 3 gram-negative strains, E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 0.21 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 0.57 uM), and S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 0.57 uM).MOA:  permeate and depolarize bacterial membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Cho et al. 2020
Literature Information.Title: Opossum Cathelicidins Exhibit Antimicrobial Activity Against a Broad Spectrum of Pathogens Including West Nile Virus
